keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Karam Shoumali from Istanbul, Hwaida Saad and Maher Samaan from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: The government of Bashar al-Assad said troops and civilians left safely, while insurgents claimed to have killed or captured some in completing their takeover of the town of Jisr al-Shoughour.

headline.print_headline: Two Sides Claim Victory as Syrian Troops Flee Hospital
headline.main: Two Sides Claim Victory as Syrian Troops Flee Hospital

snippet: The government of Bashar al-Assad said troops and civilians left safely, while insurgents claimed to have killed or captured some in completing their takeover of the town of Jisr al-Shoughour.
abstract: Both Syrian Army and their opponents, including members of Nusra Front, claim victory after Syrian government soldiers and civilians flee besieged hospital in Jisr-al-Shoughour; Pres Bashar al-Assad had vowed month earlier to free those in the hospital; government claims those besieged are now safe, but insurgents claim many were captured or killed.
